## The mess dates back to ...

My undergraduate FYP at Peking University:

.center[
*Study on the Reaction of Heparin and Neutral Red by Molecular Spectroscopy*
]

.pull-left[

![](resource/hep.png)

**Heparin**: a medication used in the treatment of heart attacks and unstable angina.

]

.pull-right[

![](resource/nr.png)

**Neutral red**: a dye used as a general stain.

]

UV-VIS Spectrophotometer & spectrofluorimeter

.small[(Zhao, 2002)]

---

## ... and the mess started in Suzhou ...

.pull-left[

- **DDTs**, a family of OrganoChlorine Pesticides (OCPs), Persistent Organic Pollutants (POPs), banned for agricultural usage from 1970s

- High concentrations in the atmosphere at the Taihu Lake .small[(Qiu et al., 2003)]

- This unknown source was the application of the *dicofol*.

- Method: Relaxed Eddy Accumulation (REA), measuring the fluxes of DDTs.

- Field experiment: A cotton field in Yancheng, Jiangsu. 

- DDTs emissions were found after the application of dicofol.

]


.pull-right[

![](resource/yancheng2003.png)

![](resource/ddt-flux.png)
.small[(Pan, 2004)]

]

---

## ... and continued in Beijing and Guangdong ...

.pull-left[

- Nitrogen fertilizer is over-used in agricultural activities in China, which has great impact on the soil and air.

- Hypothesis: Release of ammonium in fine particles

- Method: REA, measuring the fluxes of ammonium in aerosol particles.

- Field experiment: Two farmlands in Beijing and Guangdong. 

- Beijing: Emission of ammonium. 

- Guangdong: Deposition of ammonium.  

]

.pull-right[

![](resource/huizhou.jpg)

![](resource/beijing2004.png)

![](resource/guangdong2004.png)

]

.small[(Zhao, 2005)]

---
